bibl.title: In Re: Application of N. T. B. Pentreath for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington.
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western Disctrict of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol 2

div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT, COURT OF THE UNITED STATES IN AND FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICAITON OF N. T. B. PENTRTEATH, for A Writ of HABEAS CORPUS.

Upon reaadin gth epetition of the petitioner, N. T. B. Pentreath, duly signed and verified by him, whereby it appears that he is illegally imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by Thomas Delaney, Chief of Police of the City of Seattle, State of Washington, at the city jail, in said city, and stating wherein the alleged illegality consists, from which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue, it is ordered,it is ordered that a writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of this court, directed tot he said Thomas Delaney , chief of Police as aforesaid, commanding him to have the body of the said N. T. B. Pentreath before me in the court room of the said court, at 4th Ave., and Marion Street in said city of Seattle, on the 31st day of March 1905, at ten o'clock A. M. of that day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered, concerning the said petitioner, N. T. B. Pentreath together with the time and cause of his detention, and that you have then and there the said writ.
Judge of the U. S. Circuit Court.
In the United States Circuit Court FOR THEWestern DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON Northern Division
In the Matter of the Petition of N. T. B. Pentreath for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, Western Dist. of Washington.
J. L. Waller + Z. B. Rowan
